data.title: Will Not Stay Here Again
data.text: It was apparent that my non-smoking room had not been thoroughly cleaned when I found cigarettes and I think marijuana in the dresser drawer. Also the kitchenettes aren't stocked with anything you have to get tubs of utensils, pots, pans, etc from the front desk and carry them to your room and deliver them back to the front desk when you're done. They did move me to a different room,  but despite it's non-smoking designation, I could smell smoke coming in through the vents and the hallways were very smoky.

owner_response.author: 00esa, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We always want our guests to experience a seamless stay from check-in to check-out, and it's disappointing to learn that we missed the mark with your visit and there were signs of a previous guest discovered by you and not our housekeeping staff member. Please accept our sincere apologies for the lack of detail during the cleaning process. Your feedback is important to us as it allow us the opportunity to improve the experience for our future guests. We hope to have the chance to one day welcome you back again.
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good but could be better
data.text:
Pros:  Spacious rooms with full kitchen (you have to request for the kitchen amenities from the front desk).  Spacious free parking.  Walking distance to Del Amo Fashion Center.  Laundry area (prepare your quarters).  Near LAX.  Marissa at the front desk was very helpful.

Cons:  They only clean the room once a week so it could get a bit messy.  The AC in our room (Room 106) was not working properly, and despite repeated requests with the front desk, this was not immediately fixed.  There is no bellhop service, so, prepare to bring your own luggage. The hotel is near the fire station (could get noisy if the fire trucks are passing by)

Neutral:  Free breakfast consists of coffee, tea, muffins and granola bars

Tip:  Inform the hotel for late check-ins because the front desk personnel is only available up to 10.30 pm.

owner_response.author: 00esa, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for being our guest at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd. and for the feedback provided. We are happy to know that you liked the spaciousness of your room with a kitchenette and the overall service delivered by our Front Desk Team. Having said that, we are sorry for the inconvenience you experienced as the air conditioner in your room was not working properly. I have shared your concern with our engineering team, so that they can fix it immediately. Thanks again, we look forward to welcoming you and your family back soon.

Sincerely,
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Made a great 2nd home for a week
data.text: My house was being renovated and just over a week so instead of being inconvenienced I stayed here. I'm glad I did. It was a nice home away from home. Great staff and clean rooms. It definitely worked for me.

owner_response.author: 00esa, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for selecting Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd. for your visit and for sharing your comments. We are so pleased that you liked our welcoming associates and your comfortable room. Thank you again for being our guest, and we would love to welcome you back soon! 

Sincerely, 
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quality of service & room condition is very low
data.text: No Breakfast, No daily room service instead it is mentioned online. Room AC was not working properly. Carpet is very old. No necessary utensils provided. Only positive is its location however Doesn't worth of money you spend.

owner_response.author: 00esa, Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the review of our hotel. I sincerely apologize that you experienced so many difficulties during your stay with us. This is not the level of service we generally provide, and it certainly does not meet our standards. Your comments will be shared with the appropriate team members, so we can take action to prevent these issues from happening again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Business Hotel for a night
data.text: Easy to find hotel.  Clean and quiet room.  Small breakfast/coffee/fruit bar in the morning.  I was going to run in the area, but decided to drive to the Pacific.  Easy parking and a  nice run along Redondo Beach as the sun moved up over the coastal bluffs.

owner_response.author: 00esa, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Many thanks for the remarks about your recent business visit. We appreciate your feedback about your peaceful stay, our grab-and-go breakfast and beautiful location which was perfect for your needs. All of us here at Extended Stay America Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd. appreciate your business and look forward to seeing you again. Have a great day!  

Sincerely,
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Extended Stay America, Torrence, CA
data.text: I really like having a kitchen so that I can  cook my own breakfast and have simple lunch and supper. The bed is comfortable too. Great location --- only ten minutes to the ocean and lots of stores and restaurants close by.

owner_response.author: 00esa, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text:
It was our pleasure having you as our guest at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd. It's great to read you enjoyed your accommodation with a kitchenette and this was the highlight of your visit. We are also happy that you loved our location and service. We look forward to sharing your positive feedback with our team. Please visit us again the next time you are in the area.  

Sincerely,
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Extended Stay for relocation
data.text: The price was fine compared to other hotels for extended periods of time. The customer service with one or two members of the staff members was what made the stay unpleasant at times. Mary and Tammy were exceptional staff members during my stay. They were helpful when needing assistance. Friendly and Professional during my stay. However, there were two other members that were on the afternoon shift that need a little more work on customer service and professionalism. Towels were poor quality. Some staff members were protective of giving out extra towels and soap and other toiletries during my stay. Clean rooms even with service once a week. Overall comfortable for my extended stay during my relocation to the area.

owner_response.author: 00esa, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for posting your kind review of Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd. It is good to read that you liked the affordable rates we offer, as well as your well-kept accommodation. Although we are sorry for the service issues you had with some of our associates, we are glad that you loved our staff members overall. We also appreciate you recognizing Mary and Tammy, and will surely share your words with them for a job well done. It was our pleasure serving you, and we hope to have you back with us soon.

Sincerely,
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A couple Business overnights
data.text:
My impression would be similar to a few other reviews-this hotel offers a bare minimum--but then again, for the price, there were no other options in the area.
Positives--price, easy check in and out. Quiet--3rd floor. AC was effective--and quiet, so I slept very well. Negative for me was no exercise room.

owner_response.author: 00esa, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We appreciate you choosing to stay at Extended Stay America Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd. recently while on business and for the feedback provided. It's nice to read that you had a comfortable stay and you found us to be a good value. We are also happy to hear that you liked our front desk service, your accommodation and that you got a good night’s sleep. We also appreciate your observations and apologize for the inconvenience caused. We loved having you as our guest and hope to welcome you back soon. 

Sincerely,
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Clean and nice despite the bad guests they get
data.text: Unfortunately good guests and hotel employees can't know a guest is bad until they've been in and ruined their day or room for all the other well-mannered people. Place isn't bad. Breakfast is basic. Oatmeal, oranges, granola bars, muffins, coffee. All amenities are available but for sanitary and I'm sure for loss prevention reasons, they don't have their rooms stocked with said amenities because of the customers that abuse the system. But all you have to do is ask for what you need and not assume it isn't there. They have shampoo, conditioner, pots, pans, dishes, etc. Now to the really great stuff- service. Tammy at the front desk if beyond amazing. She is so friendly and genuine. Her empathy for customers and knack for customer service shows. There isn't a part in me that she would ever be able to piss off. When I needed something she was on it. Her manager Jessica is also nice be it under stress but I guess who wouldn't be working in a place where you have to deal with problems that involve guests and cops. So my advice is to have patience as a guest because we don't know what they're going through either. I was pissed at first and then realized the world doesn't revolve around me even though Tammy makes me feel like it does. To all the bad guests out there- stop making people that service you miserable, stop making costs increase for others, stop messing things up for everyone else!!!

owner_response.author: 00esa, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for sharing your detailed review of your recent visit to Extended Stay America Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd. Our goal is to make your stay as comfortable as possible and to assist you with whatever you need, so it's nice to read our team accomplished this during your visit. We especially appreciate your great remarks recognizing the service delivered by Tammy and Jessica, and we will be sure to share your compliments with them. We are also glad that the facilities provided were adequate for your needs. Thanks again, and we hope you will plan on staying with us again in the future.  

Sincerely,
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Decent place to stay
data.text: We booked this place thinking it's near to universal studios but it's 1 hour drive. Rooms are clean and good size. Staff was good . Mentions breakfast included but in name of breakfast they just have protein bars, oranges and coffee

data.title: Clean big room
data.text: I stayed for 2 nights and really enjoyed staying here.  Nice clean room full kitchen. Bed was nice ,AC work really good.  Free parking and free grab and go breakfast.  The was nice and helpful . Would stay here again

It was our pleasure serving you, and we look forward to your next stay with us soon.

data.title: This is a Terrific Hotel
data.text: The staff and reception are professional, friendly and helpful.  I initially booked the hotel thinking I would stay one night, but ended up booking a total of 6 nights.  The location is perfect and ideal next to a giant shopping mall and other locations.

owner_response.author: 00esa, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for choosing Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd. and for sharing your positive experience online. It is great to read you liked our convenient location which was perfect for your needs and that you were impressed with our friendly associates who took good care of you. We are also happy that you were satisfied with your accommodation. We like to think we provide the perfect home away from home for our guests and we are glad you agree! It was our pleasure serving you, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Sincerely,
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Never again!
data.text: I stayed over Columbus Day weekend and chose this hotel for the kitchen so I can cook one or two meals. More on that later. When I arrived, I was told I would have a room on the smoking floor, though I requested a non-smoking room. I asked if this was just for the night & was told it was for my entire stay. A little miffed, but not upset as I've stayed in smoking rooms before with no issues. Can't say that ever again. I could smell the smoke before I got off the elevator. OMGosh it was strong and only got worse when I entered the room. The smell was everywhere - in the room, bathroom, furniture, sheets, EVERYTHING! I went back to reception and begged for another room. They said they were fully booked, but offered me a candle (which is illegal I believe) to dull the scent. It didn't work. Now about the fully-equipped kitchen. How surprised was I when I looked in the cupboard to find it bare. No plates, utensils, pots/pans, dish towels. Nothing. Very disappointed. If in the area and looking for a place to stay for the night - drive pass this hotel and keep looking. Not worth a penny of your money. And I didn't mention the 2 a.m. wake up call I got from police banging and yelling for someone staying in the room across the hall from me.

owner_response.author: Holly B, General Manager at Extended Stay America - Los Angeles - Torrance Blvd., responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm sorry for your experience at our hotel. Please feel free to contact me directly at 310-540-5442 x605 to discuss.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good for Long Stays !
data.text: Stayed here for 23 nights, Room was cozy and nice. The kitchenette was well equipped with toasters, coffee maker, microwave, fridge and basic utensils and crockery. Location was quite and peaceful and staff was helpful and courteous. Ample parking space around the property and If you are not renting a car and want to roam around then a good option is Redondo beach which is very close-by. Breakfast was very basic grab and go mainly coffee, muffins, fruits and protein bars. Call out for Tammy who helped me sort out a billing issue very promptly and efficiently.

data.title: Fully equipped kitchen eh?
data.text:
We stayed here 5 nights and picked this place for the fully equipped kitchen. We intended to make at least two meals a day.
There was nothing in it except a dish drainer. We called and they brought up 2 pans and 2 forks, 2 knives, 2 spoons, 2 plates, 2 bowls. We called again and they brought up a ketchup size squeeze dish soap and dish cloth. We called again and got a sink stopper/strainer. I asked for dish TOWELS  and a salad bowl and maybe even some salt and pepper....they don't provide these. We shopped and got Lysol wipes, dish soap. paper towels, butter, 2 cup measure and plastic wrap (to nuke eggs), salt, pepper, salsa, cheese and tortillas. We bought milk and cereal and fruit. All of the supplied kitchenware was very cheap and badly burned on the bottom from the electric stove.
The bathroom was dirty and the toilet was installed crookedly. 
The staff was very nice but this place has really gone down hill since I stayed there in 2010. So, if you go and intend to cook bring your condiments etc. and the things I mentioned above. 
The third floor is smoking and you can smell it when you use the stairs.

data.title: The rooms are plain but really cozy !
data.text: The employees especially Tammy are wonderful! The bed was comfortable, it was really clean. We enjoyed our stay. Thank you so much for everything ! We will definitely return when we have a seminar next year .

data.title: Okay for a night
data.text: Stayed overnight at this property for some company related work. The hotel is about 12 miles away from LAX airport. The property offers plenty of free parking. The check-in process was easy. Upon getting into my room, I figured out that the air-conditioning wasn't working and so had to call the front desk. Johnny was kind enough to assign me another room. The new room was alright. There was nothing wow about it and for a night...meh! They do offer free breakfast, which is some oatmeal, coffee, cereal bars and fruits. They did have free wifi, one could pay more for faster wifi. The checkout process was also easy.

data.title: Great Customer Service
data.text: You get what you pay for. It's far from luxury, but it gets the job done if you are looking for a simple, decent place to stay with or without your pet. I would give the accommodation overall 2 stars (thin scratchy towels, gum on the bathroom floor, no hair conditioner, outdated & thin bed sheets and blankets) but the management (especially Holly) 5 stars.

data.title: June 2015
data.text:
Found this on Priceline Express for one night.  We were going to Catalina the next day so only about 30 minutes from Long Beach Catalina Express port.

Exterior and lobby were fine, except the lobby was rather small.  Room was clean except the sink had some black gunk dried in the bottom, which I scrubbed to get out.  Had not stayed in "extended" hotel that I can remember.  Bit hard to find after dark because the sign was not lighted.  Quick check-in.  The free internet was fast enough for us but several faster speeds were available at additional cost.  Bed was comfortable.  Unusual that no glasses or coffee maker were available unless requested.  Either my wife or I had to go back to the front desk to get glasses and dishes, which were quite heavy.  We had leftovers from previous night so plates and silverware were welcome.  The breakfast was grab-n-go, meaning fruit, coffee and granola bars displayed near the door.  Adequate but not very filling.

data.title: Jan 2015
data.text:
No workout room but a walk or run down the street anytime of year gets the heart going. Breakfast is less than the norm these days but you have the option to cook something in your room.
Some good restaurants in the area including Alpine Village.
